content:
• Friday, January 26, 2018
  • CASI

    CASI Pharmaceuticals buys ANDA portfolio from Sandoz

    • CASI Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:CASI) has acquired a portfolio of abbreviated new drug applications from Sandoz.
    • The applications include 25 FDA-approved ANDAs, one ANDA that has tentative approval from the FDA, and three that are still pending approval.
    • CASI says it plans to choose and commercialize some products based on market opportunity and the prospect of cost-effective manufacturing in China and/or the U.S.
    • Shares are up 3.1% in postmarket trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:00 PM | 6 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers (1/26/2018)

    • Top gainers: AMRN +1.9%. SOGO +1.5%. GDS +1.2%. GFI +1.1%.
    • Top losers: ROYT -10.1%. SBBX -3.2%. SE -1.7%. TRN -1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 8 Comments

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers (1/26/18)

    • Top gainers: UNG +7.7%. EWZ +6.4%. ILF +5.6%. OIL +5.5%. BRF +5.3%.
    • Top losers: URA -1.9%. TAN -1.8%. UUP -1.7%. KBWD -1.1%. PGF -0.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • MOMO

    Momo +1.2% as JPMorgan boosts to Overweight

    • Momo (NASDAQ:MOMO) ADRs are adding to gains today after getting an upgrade to Overweight from JPMorgan.
    • Shares are up 1.2% after hours; they gained 1.8% during the regular session.
    • Along with the boost from a Neutral stance, JPMorgan has raised its price target to $40 from $30, implying 32% upside from today's close.
    • The ADRs are up 34% since the beginning of December.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM | 22 Comments
  • NLY

    Bloodbath in mortgage REITs continues

    • If the story of 2017 was the mREIT (BATS:REM) sector nearly-universally trading above book value, the story so far in 2018 is the quick retreat back below book by many of the names, with investors mulling what might be a speedier pace of rate hikes.
    • The month isn't over yet, but some January stats: Annaly Capital (NYSE:NLY) down 8.25%, AGNC Investment down 3.3%, CYS Investment (NYSE:CYS) down 10.65%, Armour Residential (NYSE:ARR) down 4.6%, Invesco Mortgage (NYSE:IVR) down 3.4%, MFA Financial (NYSE:MFA) down 6.2%.
    • The S&P 500 is up 7.3%.
    • ETFs: MORL, REM, MORT
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 119 Comments
  • CXW

    Administration memo sends Corecivic and GEO Group higher

    • A DOJ memo dated Wednesday suggests boosting the amount of inmates in private prisons.
    • Both previously down for the day, Corecivic (CXW +5.6%) and GEO Group (GEO +3%) have both moved sharply higher late in the session.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 19 Comments
  • PF

    Pinnacle Foods races higher on report of Third Point stake

    • A modestly red day for Pinnacle Foods (PF +4.3%) has turned sharply into the green in the past few minutes, with Reuters reporting Dan Loeb's hedge fund as having built a stake.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • WYNN

    Wynn defended at Morgan Stanley; shares down 10%

    • via Bloomberg
    • If the stock gets weak enough, says the team, Wynn (WYNN -10.4%) might begin to look pretty attractive as a takeover target.
    • As to the charges themselves, they're concerning, but also maybe old news, says Morgan, noting allegations in a Bloomberg story from late last year.
    • While Steve Wynn is the company's driving force, there is an ample bench of executives.
    • Previously: Steve Wynn hit with sexual misconduct report; shares dive more than 5% (Jan. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 38 Comments
  • CPAH

    CounterPath closes private placement of shares

    • CounterPath (CPAH -6%) has filed that it closed a private placement of 427,500 shares.
    • That placement came at a price of $4.01/share
    • Gross proceeds were $1.714M. Net proceeds will be used, the company says, to expand sales and business development resources and fund integration of the Company’s UC solutions with other enterprise applications, along with general purposes.
    • The company's largest shareholder, Wesley Clover International, along with No. 2 holder KMB Trac Two Holdings, subscribed for an 125,000 shares each.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • POL

    PolyOne -4% as raw material costs may increase further

    • PolyOne (POL -3.9%) plunges to a 52-week low after saying its raw material costs could rise further in Q1 and that it does not expect Y/Y income and margin growth in its Specialty Engineered Materials unit until H2 2018.
    • In its Q4 earnings report, POL said continued raw material inflation and supply-chain disruptions hurt margins in every business; the company's material costs on average rose 10% Q/Q and 15%-20% Y/Y.
    • POL said in its earnings conference call that 2017 was "a difficult year for Engineered Materials and the industry as a whole" due to raw material pricing pressures, but it expects cash flow to improve in 2018, reflecting underlying earnings improvements, savings from new and ongoing projects, and benefits from lower U.S. tax rates.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • TWTR

    Citron on Twitter train amid deal chatter; shares up 9.3%

    • Already up strong on the day, Twitter (NYSE:TWTR) shares are up 9.3% and re-nearing a 52-week high hit two weeks ago with deal rumors circulating, and noted short seller Citron Research issuing praise.
    • Unsupported chatter about a potential buyout by Salesforce.com (CRM +1.3%) is fueling some of the buying, Bloomberg notes. Call volume on TWTR is outpacing put volume by a factor of eight today.
    • Meanwhile, Citron says it gets a lot of emails about what it might be buying in this market. "Have been long $TWTR and agree with Hedgeye and Greenlight that 2018 is the year for $TWTR," the firm tweets.
    • "Target $35, Think Tencent buys," Citron continues. "Now go bash Citron on $TWTR." A $35 target implies another 44% upside from today's sharply higher price.
    • Tencent (OTCPK:TCEHY) is up 2.8% on the day.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM | 88 Comments
  • INTC

    Semiconductors finish week strong on Intel earnings

    • Semiconductors showing strength in the final stretch of the week with the Philadelphia Semiconductor Index up 2.6% today.
    • Semi-related stocks that reported earnings this week: Intel (INTC +9.6%), KLA-Tencor (KLAC -0.4%), Lam Research (LRCX +1.1%), Maxim Integrated Products (MXIM +5.8%), Teradyne (TER +5.3%), and Xilinx (XLNX +2%). 
    • Other semi stocks that have been on the move:  ON Semiconductors (ON +4.2%), ASML (ASML +2.7%), Micron (MU +0.6%), Analog Devices (ADI +1.6%), and Cirrus Logic (CRUS +1%).     
    • Semi ETFs: SOXL, SOXX, SMH, USD, PSI, XSD, SOXS, SSG, FTXL, XTH
    • Previously: Lam Research +3.4% on Q2 beats, upside guidance (Jan. 24)
    • Previously: Teradyne -6% despite Q4 beats, in-line guidance (Jan. 24)
    • Previously: Maxim Integrated Products +5.2% after Q2 report, upside guidance (Jan. 26)
    • Previously: Xilinx +4.5% after Q3 revenue beat, ninth consecutive quarter rev growth (Jan. 24)
    • Previously: KLA-Tencor -1.1% after Q2 report with downside guidance (Jan. 26)
    • Previously: Intel +4.5% on Q4 beats, data center growth, upside guidance (Jan. 25)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM | 70 Comments

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 pm (1/26/18)

    • Gainers: MYSZ +13%. RPD +10%. NSYS +10%. EGHT +10%. VMW +10%.
    • Losers: OTCPK:LBCC -8%. QD -7%. DVMT -7%. CPAH -7%. CCIH -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 3 Comments
  • HRC

    Needham: Hill-Rom CEO exit a 'loss' - shares down 3.4%

    • CEO John Greisch's surprise departure is a loss, says analyst Mike Matson, thanks to his strong track record and investor relationships.
    • Turning to FQ1 results, Matson takes note of slowing organic growth, but - believing new products will drive more revenue - boosts his FY18 EPS estimate to $4.62 from $4.59 and FY19 to $5.14 from $5.11.
    • He maintains a Buy rating and $105 price target (nearly 20% upside).
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • HRC -3.4%
    • Previously: Hill-Rom chief to retire in Q3 (Jan. 26)
    • Previously: Hill-Rom Holdings Q1 revenues up 5%; non-GAAP EPS up 23%; updates guidance (Jan. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • IP

    International Paper higher on report of price hike

    • International Paper (NYSE:IP) is higher on reports the company hiked its containerboard pricing by $50 per ton.
    • Shares of International Paper are up 2.0% in afternoon trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • MITK

    Mitek Systems -5.3% after Q1 beats, in-line guidance

    • Mitek Systems (NASDAQ:MITK) shares are down 5.3% following yesterday’s Q1 report, which beat EPS and revenue estimates.
    • In-line FY18 guidance has revenue from $57M to $59M ($58.04M) and profit margin of 19% to 20%.   
    • Press release       
    • Previously: Mitek Systems beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (Jan. 25)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm (1/26/2018)

    • Gainers: RKDA +11%. CRK +8%. GSV +8%. USAU +7%. ZN +6%.
    • Losers: LTBR -14%. CRR -11%. TMST -10%. NOG -9%. PES -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM | 4 Comments
  • GSIT

    GSI Technology -5.4% after Q3 results with downside guidance

    • GSI Technology (NASDAQ:GSIT) shares are down 5.4% following yesterday’s Q3 report, which beat revenue estimates but missed on EPS.
    • Downside guidance for Q4 includes revenue of $10M to $11M (consensus: $12.5M) and gross margin from 53% to 55%. 
    • Press release  
    • Previously: GSI Technology misses by $0.03, beats on revenue (Jan. 25)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • NXGN

    Quality Systems -1.7% on Q3 report with in-line guidance

    • Quality Systems (QSII) shares are down 1.7% after yesterday’s Q3 report beat revenue estimates but met on EPS.
    • Reaffirmed in-line FY18 guidance has revenue of $522M to $530M (consensus: $526.54M) and EPS from $0.64 to $0.68 (consensus: $0.68).   
    • Press release       
    • Previously: Quality Systems EPS in-line, beats on revenue (Jan. 25)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM
  • ABBV

    Big biopharma in the green after AbbVie's Q4 beat

    • AbbVie (ABBV +10.6%) is leading its large-cap brethren after posting steller Q4 results and bullish 2018 guidance.
    • Related tickers: (JNJ +0.2%)(OTCQX:RHHBY +0.2%)(AGN -0.6%)(AZN +1.3%)(BMY +1%)(LLY +1.1%)(GSK +1.4%)(MRK +0.7%)(PFE +4.4%)(NVS +0.4%)(NVO +0.8%)(SHPG +2.3%)(VRX -1.8%)
    • Previously: AbbVie Q4 revenues up 14%; non-GAAP EPS up 23%; updates guidance (Jan. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM | 11 Comments
  • SBH

    Sally Beauty Holdings swings lower

    • Sally Beauty Holdings (SBH -2.6%) heads lower after data tracker M Science posts a negative assessment on the retailer's sales growth.
    • Sally Beauty is due to report earnings on February 8.
    • Shares of SBH were down as much as 5% earlier.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 3 Comments

  • Financial - Top Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 pm (1/26/2018)

    • Gainers: WRLD +17%. LMFA +12%. GROW +7%. AJG +6%. NOAH +6%.
    • Losers: TBBK -12%. AHL -11%. DCOM -7%. FHB -5%. FSBW -5%.

  • Midday Gainers / Losers (1/26/2018)

    • Gainers: OTC:BSPM +66%. OASM +48%. CAPR +25%. RDHL +19%. ABAX +18%. PULM +18%. WRLD +16%. VMW +14%. FWP +14%. MYSZ +13%.
    • Losers: MNKD -21%. LTBR -13%. TBBK -12%. AHL -12%. OGEN -11%. SENS -10%. TMST -10%. CRR -10%. PATK -9%. THO -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM | 2 Comments
  • MXIM

    Maxim Integrated Products +5.2% after Q2 report, upside guidance

    • Maxim Integrated Products (NASDAQ:MXIM) shares are up 5.2% following yesterday’s Q2 report that beat on revenue and met on EPS.
    • Upside Q3 guidance has revenue from $620M to $660M (consensus: $602.21M), EPS of $0.66 to $0.72 (consensus: $0.63), and gross margin from 66% to 68%. 
    • Guidance is based on the $446M 90-day backlog at the beginning of the March quarter and the expected turns. 
    • Press release  
    • Previously: Maxim Integrated Products EPS in-line, beats on revenue (Jan. 25)
    • Previously: Maxim Integrated Products declares $0.42 dividend (Jan. 25)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • WYNN

    Steve Wynn hit with sexual misconduct report; shares dive more than 5%

    • A WSJ report alleges a decades-long pattern of sexual misconduct by Steve Wynn.
    • Responding, Wynn says the accusations come about thanks to his ex-wife, with whom he is involved in a legal battle over a revised divorce settlement.
    • WYNN -5.25%
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM | 101 Comments
  • WDC

    Analyst adjust Western Digital ratings, price targets after earnings

    • Summit Redstone downgrades Western Digital (NYSE:WDC) from Buy to Hold following yesterday’s earnings report.
    • Analyst Kinngai Chan cites “high risk of gross margin compression given recent pricing dynamics in NAND flash and client SSD markets." 
    • Chan says recent checks show the recent NAND/SSD price declines to continue into the end of the month. 
    • RBC rates Western Digital at Outperform with a $115 price target (31% upside on yesterday’s close). 
    • Analyst Amit Daryanani notes that the March quarter showed better gross margins than expected and that the margin forecast of 42% to 43% “should provide investors conviction that even if there are NAND price declines the company should be able to comfortably generate >40% gross margins in the foreseeable future.” 
    • Cowen rates Western Digital at Outperform and cuts the price target by $7 to $110 (25% upside).   
    • Analyst Karl Ackerman says the company’s NAND position remains healthy, but NAND won’t be the upside lever it was last year. 
    • Ackerman says investors are focused on “oscillating NAND ASPs” since the major NAND players all anticipate growing supply toward the higher end of their outlooks. 
    • Analyst thinks robust hyperscale enterprise HDD and SDD business will drive FCF to a new record in 2018. 
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word 
    • Western Digital shares are down 0.9% to $87.18.      
    • Previously: Western Digital -3.9% despite Q2 beats (update) (Jan. 25)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM | 13 Comments

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm (1/26/2018)

    • Gainers: ONP +16%. NBEV +9%. SGOC +7%. JAKK +6%
    • Losers: THO -9%. LCII -8%. WGO -7%. CL -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • PULM

    Pulmatrix adds to up move, shares ahead 18%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Pulmatrix (PULM +17.9%) builds on yesterday's spike on a 10x surge in volume. Shares have rallied 38% since then.
    • Consistent with other recent breakouts by tiny biotechs, no particular news accounts for the action.
    • Preclinical data on inhaled itraconazole Pulmazole will be presented at the 8th Advances Against Aspergillosis Conference in Lisbon, Portugal next week.
    • A Phase 1/1b clinical trial assessing Pulmazole for the treatment of allergic bronchopulmonary aspergillosis in asthma patients should start soon.
    • At the end of Q3 2017, the company had $6.4M in cash and equivalents. Operations consumed $11.3M through the first three quarters.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • NEE

    NextEra exploring potential sale of Canadian portfolio

    • NextEra Energy (NEE +1.6%) yieldco NextEra Energy Partners (NEP +1.2%) says it is considering the sale of Canadian wind and solar farms that total ~400 MW.
    • NEP execs said during today's earnings conference call that the company could recycle capital back into its U.S. assets if the sale is completed.
    • The move could allow the company to benefit from a “longer federal income tax shield” and retain more capital, NEP also said.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • EGHT

    Comms firm 8x8 +12% as analysts praise Q3 beat

    • After earnings, 8x8 (NASDAQ:EGHT) is having its best day in nearly 20 years, now up 12.4% on a quarter where it raised service revenues by 20%.
    • The stock got price-target raises from B. Riley (to $16 from $14; B. Riley is Neutral on the stock) and from Needham (to $19 from $16).
    • Robert Baird, meanwhile, reiterated its Buy rating and $21 price target.
    • And pointing to a "bounce back" in new business, BofA Merrill Lynch has raised its target to $22, implying 37% upside from yesterday's close. The company continues to gain important enterprise reference customers, the firm notes.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 3 Comments
  • SLG

    SL Green catches upgrade at Stifel

    • Real estate valuations "are simply too attractive to ignore," says analyst John Guinee, upgrading SL Green (NYSE:SLG) to Buy from Hold. His $111 price target suggests about 15% upside.
    • One Vanderbilt, he says, could be the most significant single-building office development in the U.S. in the last 50 years, and rents will surprise investors to the upside.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • Shares +0.3%
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • ABBV

    AbbVie continues to deliver with Humira; shares up 10% after strong Q4

    • AbbVie's (ABBV +10%) top seller HUMIRA (adalimumab) continues to be plump cash cow for the company. In a presentation at JPM18, CEO Rick Gonzalez said it will remain so for a few years to come since it has patent protection from biosimilars until 2022.
    • HUMIRA 2017 sales by quarter:
    • Q4: $4,892 (+14.0%).
    • Q3: $4,701 (+15.9%).
    • Q2: $4,716 (+13.7%).
    • Q1: $4,118 (+15.1%).
    • The relatively consistent growth rates are heavily influenced by the consistent price increases.
    • Previously: AbbVie Q4 revenues up 14%; non-GAAP EPS up 23%; updates guidance (Jan. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM | 29 Comments

  • Healthcare Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am (1/26/2018)

    • Gainers: OTC:BSPM +90%. CAPR +31%. OASM +18%. RDHL +15%. ABAX +14%.
    • Losers: MNKD -17%. VTGN -10%. CBIO -8%. PACB -7%. SENS -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 2 Comments
  • AHL

    Aspen Insurance down 12.5% after Q4 update; insurance chief fired

    • The company expects to book an underwriting loss of about $245M in Q4, thanks to catastrophe losses as well as an increased frequency of mid-sized and attritional losses in the insurance operation.
    • Aspen (AHL -12.5%) CEO Chris O'Kane: "We are deeply disappointed with our financial performance ... We have taken a number of actions to improve our underwriting performance."
    • Among those actions: Aspen Insurance CEO Stephen Postlewhite has been fired. President and Chief Underwriting Officer David Cohen will take over his portfolio.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM | 3 Comments
  • ABAX

    Abaxis FQ3 beat propels shares, up 15%

    • Thinly traded Abaxis (ABAX +14.9%) is up in early trading on more than a 60% spike in volume, albeit on turnover of only 245K shares.
    • After the close yesterday, it reported fiscal Q3 non-GAAP EPS of $0.31 (-11.4%) on revenues of $59.7M (+12.9%), both above consensus. GAAP EPS was $0.18 (-40.0%).
    • Previously: abaxis beats by $0.03, beats on revenue (Jan. 25)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • GE

    GE slumps to $16 as analyst sees 'more questions than answers'

    • General Electric (GE -1%) shares slide again after J.P. Morgan's Stephen Tusa says there are still "more questions than answers" following the company's Q4 results and disclosure of an SEC investigation.
    • "We don't know how a value investor or ratings agency analyst can have confidence in the ultimate value of assets here, most notably what's hung up on the industrial balance sheet, which will get a harder look by any potential buyer as the portfolio begins to come apart," writes Tusa, who rates GE at Underweight with a $16 price target.
    • Tusa views GE'a annual guidance as "a stretch," and continues to see a "levered industrial company with weak levels of [free cash flow]... with a side dish of levered finco, with a management team in the tough position, working to prevent a 'hard landing' in which bond investors start to worry about liquidity."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM | 89 Comments
  • TWTR

    Twitter gains while analysts fade COO departure

    • Twitter (NYSE:TWTR) is making a move early today, up 5.1% to recoup a couple of days of declines.
    • On Yahoo, JP Mangalindan notes analysts aren't quite as spooked as investors are by the departure of COO Anthony Noto to run SoFi. A lot of what Noto put in place will continue, says Altimeter Group's Omar Akhtar.
    • Other analysts expressed similar sentiments. Noto's replaceable because Twitter has a "deep bench," says Summit Redstone's Jonathan Kees, along with management alumni who might be available like former COO Adam Bain.
    • And JPMorgan's Douglas Anmuth says Noto's exit isn't "thesis changing."
    • Shares have gained 18.4% over the past six months.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM | 15 Comments
  • KLAC

    Analysts raise KLA-Tencor targets after earnings, discuss guidance

    • Needham raises its KLA-Tencor (NASDAQ:KLAC) price target by $5 to $135, a 1% upside on yesterday’s closing price.
    • Firm says outlook suggests a stable business, which means slower near-term growth compared to peers. 
    • Growth drivers include EUV, new products, and China and those could drive KLA-Tencor towards a better growth trajectory entering 2H18. 
    • Stifel reiterates Buy rating and $139 price target (4% upside). 
    • Firm says that KLA-Tencor provided a more modest March quarter outlook compared to Lam Research. While KLA has improved its memory exposure, Lam still has more concentration.
    • Stifel expects momentum to pick up later in the year due to seasonal strength in the foundry/logic segment. 
    • B. Riley ups its price target from $129 to $142 (7% upside). 
    • Firm says bears will likely focus on the modest guidance but that 2018’s favorable linearity refutes arguments of peak shipments. 
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
    • KLA-Tencor shares are up 2.2% to $115.55.      
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM | 1 Comment
  • CAPR

    Capricor breaks out of consolidation, up 30%

    • Capricor Therapeutics (CAPR +29.6%) has cleared near-term consolidation on triple normal volume.
    • Ten days ago, it announced that it had expanded its licensing deal with Cedars-Sinai Medical Center, securing exclusive global rights to develop cardiosphere-derived cells (CDCs) and other candidates.
    • A Phase 2 clinical trial, HOPE-2, assessing Duchenne muscular dystrophy candidate CAP-1002 is poised to start enrollment.
    • At the end of September 2017, the company had ~$13.9M in quick assets. Operations consumed $11.6M through the first three quarters.
    • Previously: Capricor licenses additional patent applications from Cedars-Sinai Medical Center for cellular and exosome-based technologies (Jan. 16)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • MDR

    McDermott-CB&I merger clears U.S. antitrust hurdle

    • The planned $6B merger of McDermott International (NYSE:MDR) and Chicago Bridge & Iron (NYSE:CBI) clears an antitrust hurdle, as the U.S. Federal Trade Commission granted early termination of a required waiting period.
    • The Hart-Scott-Rodino Act of 1976 establishes waiting periods that typically must elapse in order for a merger to be assessed for its impact on market competition.
    • The proposed tie-up now only needs approval for the shareholders of the two companies, completion of financing and some other conditions, and regulatory clearance in Russia.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM | 17 Comments
  • AJG

    Arthur J. Gallagher & Co. acquires Market Financial Group & Austin Consulting Group

    • Arthur J. Gallagher & Co. (AJG +5.7%) announced the acquisition of Crystal Lake, Illinois-based Market Financial Group & its affiliate, Austin Consulting Group. Terms of the transaction were not disclosed.
    • Market Financial Group is a risk management and human resources consultant and broker providing property/casualty and human resources solutions in Illinois. Austin Consulting Group is an insurance consultant, finance & insurance advocate.
    • "Market Financial Group and Austin Consulting Group are complementary, well-run businesses with a marketing approach that is closely aligned with Gallagher's," said J. Patrick Gallagher, Jr., Chairman, President and CEO. "I am excited to welcome Rich, Rob, Ken and their associates to our growing Gallagher family of professionals."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • BSPM

    Biostar pharma jumps out of the blocks, up 108%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Biostar Pharmaceuticals (OTC:BSPM +107.8%) is the top gainer in the market this morning. Shares are up on a whopping 58x surge in volume only 30 minutes into the session on no particular news.
    • The Xiangyang, China-based firm sells its products in-country. Top seller is Xin Ao Xing Oleanolic Acid Capsules for the treatment of hepatitis B.
    • At the end of September 2017, the company had only $365K in cash.
    • Previously: Biostar up 42% but news scarce (Oct. 9, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • AMZN

    Morgan Stanley bull case puts Amazon over $1T market cap

    • Morgan Stanley increases its Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) price target from $1,260 to $1,400, a 1.6% upside on yesterday’s close.
    • Firm raises its bull case price target by $100 to $2,100, which would give Amazon an over $1T market cap. 
    • Analyst Brian Nowak says he underestimated the ad aspect of Amazon’s business and the firm remains “bullish Amazon’s ad opportunity as the company continues to drive its high margin revenue stream businesses that enable it to invest harder than ever and deliver upward revisions.” 
    • Nowak estimates that Amazon’s sponsored ad business will grow 54% per year from 2016 to 2019. 
    • Morgan Stanley maintains an Overweight rating on Amazon. 
    • Amazon shares are up 1% to $1,392.03. 
       
     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM | 184 Comments
  • WGO

    Northcoast cautious on RV sector

    • Northcoast Research lowers Winnebago (WGO -5.9%) and Thor Industries (THO -4.9%) to a Neutral rating from Buy due to concerns that dealer inventory is at an "unsustainable level" for 2018.
    • The firm is more comfortable with Camping World (CWH +0.7%) as a RV play and  initiates the stock with a Buy rating and $56 price target.
    • Sources: CNBC and Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM | 22 Comments
  • AAPL

    Rosenblatt, BTIG disagree on Apple's Q1 potential

    • Rosenblatt Securities thinks Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) will beat analyst estimates in Q1 due to higher-than-expected iPhone X production in the period.
    • Analyst Jun Zhang calls risks in Q1 “overblown” even though Apple’s forecast could come in below analyst estimates as iPhone sales decelerate. 
    • Zhang expects Apple to recognize a portion of iPhone X units produced in December and iPhone SE2 shipments that could begin in early March. 
    • Firm rates Apple at Buy with a $180 price target, a 5% upside on yesterday’s close.
    • More action: BTIG analyst Walter Piecyck thinks Apple will guide March quarter revenues as low as $60B (consensus: $68B).
    • Piecyck writes that smartphone upgrade rates remain at record lows and don’t appear ready for a Q1 rebound since customers are simply holding onto their phones longer. 
    • BTIG rates Apple at Buy with a $198 price target, a 15% upside on yesterday’s close.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word   
    • Apple will report earnings on February 1. 
    • Apple shares are up 0.4% to $171.79.

  • SBUX

    Holiday offers a dud for Starbucks while Shanghai shines

    • Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) execs admitted on yesterday's conference call that holiday offers and merchandise didn't resonate with consumers as planned despite what was a solid period in the U.S. retail sector. "Our core beverage comp, excluding holiday limited time offers was 1 percent. And together our holiday LTO and lobby items had a negative impact of over 1 point of comp," noted CEO Kevin Johnson.
    • Management also maintained that the company was not losing business to cannibalization or rising competition from other coffee sellers.
    • One area that went exceedingly well for Starbucks was China, where same-store sales were up 6%. The coffee chain's new Reserve Roastery in Shanghai in particular was a smashing success. Starbucks Chairman Howard Schultz noted that while U.S. Starbucks stores average about $32K a week in business, the Reserve Roastery in Shanghai is averaging twice that each day after eight weeks of being open.
    • There's is plenty of buzzing on Starbucks from Wall Street this morning, including Goldman Sachs removing the stock from its Conviction List. Piper Jaffray (Overweight, $70 PT) and Bank of America Merril Lynch (Buy, $66 PT) both issued a positive assessment on the long-term story with Starbucks,

  • SLDB

    Solid Biosciences debuts today after disclosure misstep

    • Trading in IPO Solid Biosciences (NASDAQ:SLDB) kicks off today after an embarrassing gaff related its failure to disclose an FDA-stipulated partial clinical hold on its Phase 1/2 study assessing Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) candidate SGT-001.
    • The company received the communication from the FDA in November 2017 citing the need for the company to demonstrate that it has the appropriate manufacturing processes in place to support the higher-dose group. Low-dose SGT-001 is not affected.
    • The matter appears routine, but the company's stumble has forced it to lower its offering price to $16 a share from the expected range of $18 - 19 that it announced only two days ago.
    • DMD leader Sarepta Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SRPT) is, no doubt, following the action with interest.
    • Update: Indicating an opening of $24.
    • Update: Shares opened at $25.50.

  • CL

    Pricing nips at Colgate-Palmolive's margins

    • Colgate-Palmolive (NYSE:CL) reports organic sales increased 2.0% in Q4 to miss the consensus estimate for a 2.9% rise. Organic sales in North America were up 1%, while Asia Pacific organic sales increased 2.5%.
    • Global unit volume was up 3.0% during the quarter, while pricing decreased 1.0%. The company saw a positive benefit from F/X swings of 2.5 percentage points.
    • Gross margin arrived at 60.4% of sales vs. 60.8% a year ago and 61.0% consensus. Higher raw and packaging material costs and lower pricing nipped at margins.
    • SG&A expenses wee 35.3% of sales vs. 33.7% a year ago.
    • Operating profit margin fell 190 bps to 26.0% of sales.
    • Looking ahead, Colgate-Palmolive expects category growth this year to be "challenging" but sees a reduction in its effective tax rate to 26% to 27%.
    • Shares of Colgate-Palmolive are down 2.99% in premarket action.

  • AZN

    AstraZeneca's PT010 successful in late-stage COPD study; shares up 1% premarket

    • AstraZeneca (NYSE:AZN) is up 1% premarket on average volume on the heels of its announcement of positive results from a Phase 3 clinical trial, KRONOS, evaluating triplet therapy PT010 in patients chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) over a 24-week treatment period.
    • Results showed PT010 achieved eight out of nine lung function primary endpoints based on forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1) measurements in patients with moderate-to-very severe COPD.
    • KRONOS compared PT010 (budesonide/glycopyrronium/formarate 320/14.4/9.5µg) to Bevespi Aerosphere (glycopyrronium/formoterol fumarate 14.4/9.6µg), Symbicort Turbohaler (budesonide/formoterol fumarate 400/12µg) and PT009 (budesonide/formoterol fumarate 320/9.6µg). Participants received two inhalations twice a day.
    • Detailed results will be submitted for presentation at an upcoming medical conference. Regulatory submissions in Japan and China should be filed in H2, followed by applications in the U.S. and Europe in 2019.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:12 AM | 4 Comments
